newsitem.title: USA: Boeing aims at $1 billion annual cost savings.
newsitem.headline: Boeing aims at $1 billion annual cost savings.

text.p: Boeing Co Chief Executive Phil Condit told reporters on Sunday he aimed for at least $1 billion in annual cost savings once his company had merged with McDonnell Douglas Corp.
"We really think there are some significant savings and we're going to be going after a billion dollars of savings or more a year," Condit told a news conference to announce the merger.
"We're going to be going -- combined -- from on the order of $35 billion dollars total revenue 1996 ... to about $48 billion 1997, so we are in a growth environment," he said.

"If we're in an environment where we're needing more and more people, we're going to be able to eliminate -- in fact we can eliminate -- redundancies and still have job stability. It just means we won't hire," he added.
Condit said there was always the potential for job cuts, but added that he did not expect these to be significant.
"There are going to be still overlaps in a couple of places. We're going to have to look at each of those. I don't think those are going to be significant," he said.
